label: Description
value: A) Link necklace with clasp. Design of alternating motives a) oval amethysts surrounded by paste-diamonds and b) clover-leaf of three amethysts with gold bar for stem; five pendants, at center and outside. B) Two links each similar to a), between these pendants are two showing clover-leaf motif of three paste-diamonds above an amethyst (pointed oval in shape) surrounded by paste-diamonds.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William E. Strong

label: Description
value: Waistcoat with standing collar and slightly curved hem, in green grosgrain silk embroidered with silk thread in a delicate pink and green floral design of tiny flowers sprinkled over the front. Denser sprays on pocket flaps, placket and standing collar. Originally made for a made and altered to fit a small boy.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on silk foundation Technique: embroidered in chain stitch on ribbed plain weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1917: Robert Talmadge  collection; 1917: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Man's waistcoat of white satin embroidered in muted tones of dark pink, green and yellow-green. Design of conventionalized flowers and leafy stems.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: satin stitch embroidery on a satin foundation
The Landing of the Fathers at Plymouth

label: Description
value: Slightly tapered globular body with cylindrical collar and simple lip; shaped flat handle.  Decorated on two sides with medallion showing THE LANDING OF THE FATHERS AT PLYMOUTH, and medallion with names of leading pilgrims with date of landing.

label: Provenance
value: Robert van Boskerck; 1917: acquired by Museum

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: needle lace with ground of loop & twist with loop & twist return

label: Description
value: Box shows houses and trees, with a hot air balloon; legend: "Clayton's Ascent." Lid features legend: "A Peep at the Moon." A telescope, attached to a skeleton framework, is focused on the moon.  Life on the moon is plainly visible. Three aeronautical figures with wings are engaged in temporal pursuits. A lamb appears in the foreground with palm trees and volcano in the background. Printed in pink, white and green on a cream field.

label: Physical description
value: Block printed on handmade paper, pasteboard support

label: Provenance
value: From the Alexander Wilson Drake Collection.   Drake Number: 232.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

This design continues three times around the circumference of the box. Border paper around lid: on green ground, branching stem block-printed in white and pink.

Valley among Mountains, Guanoco, near Guaranda, Ecuador.

label: Description
value: Horizontal oblique distant view of a valley stretching toward right, with a house visible in the central foreground and two people walking at the right.  Lateral, high bottom margins.

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of a series of sketches from the Rio Magdalena, Columbia: Trees reflected in water at top left; a group of trees at right; and bank of the river at bottom.
Sketches from South America: Palmgroves and Landscapes

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of palms standing on a high river bank, shown from below is at top row, left; a river bank with an indentation, behind which a group of palms is seen, with a mountain visible in the right background and  with trees in the left background, are at right; and a mountain panorama rising behind a river bank is seen at bottom.
Sketches of a Man's Head and Floating Iceberg

label: Description
value: Sketchbook page with sketches and inscriptions. At bottom half, a floating iceberg with the word "blue" inscribed over the form and "purple" inscribed at the water. At lower left, a man's head shown in profile, wearing a hat. Inscriptions throughout.

label: Description
value: Oil sketch of classical ruin. Foreground is filled with architectural fragments.  Three Corinthian columns with entablature and fragment of another column stand upright. The upper parts of the columns are lit by the setting sun. An arch of the substructure and a seated Bedouin are shown in the right center of the foreground.

label: Description
value: Verso: Snowy hills, wooded hilltop (left view of recto)

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of the valley with the stream shown in the extreme right foreground and middle ground; a plateau with houses located in the central and left middle ground; and hills and mountain ranges in the background, with the volcano in the left center of the distant background.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and oxidized white gouache on buff colored paper
Ruins of St. George Church, Lydda [present day Lod]

label: Description
value: Vertical view at top of the ruins of the Church of St. George in Lydda (Lod). View from a lateral nave into the apse.  An Islamic building is shown in the left rear, trees in the right rear.  The entablature and the capital of the embedded column of the main nave are detailed at left.  Sections of a pilaster of an arch of mouldings and details of capitals are shown at the bottom.  Indication of an East direction. Verso: horizontal view at top of an Arab riding, a woman walking and carrying a load upon her head, both shown from the back; a distant view of the village Gazur, with a road shown obliquely in the foreground in the center; and a view across a plain looking towards a hill range at the bottom.

label: Provenance
value: Louis P. Church; 1917: acquired by the Museum
